rules.natural: Whenever the council enacts the environmental law, it is not the case that the committee preserves the historic building.
Under the condition that the council enacts the heritage law, the committee does not preserve the historic building.
The council enacts the economic law or the council enacts the environmental law or the council enacts the heritage law.
If the council funds the zoning plan, then the facility opens the community center.
Provided that the committee delays the zoning plan, the mayor vetoes the zoning plan occurs.

rules.prover9_expression: (exhibits(planner, artwork_display) -> (-(modifies(committee, zoning_plan) -> delays(committee, zoning_plan)) -> approves(public, zoning_plan)))
rules.natural: If the planner exhibits the artwork display, then given that not modifying the zoning plan implies delaying the zoning plan does not hold, the public approves the zoning plan.
Whenever the implication that the mayor approves the zoning plan leads to council funding does not hold, the committee modifies the zoning plan follows.
Under the condition that the committee modifying the zoning plan does not necessarily lead to delaying it, the public does not approve the zoning plan.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(approves(mayor, zoning_plan) -> funds(council, zoning_plan)) -> delays(committee, zoning_plan)) -> -demolishes(contractor, historic_building))
rules.natural: If the failure of the implication that the mayor approves leading to council funding to cause committee delays does not hold, then the contractor does not demolish the historic building.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(-(approves(mayor, zoning_plan) -> funds(council, zoning_plan)) -> delays(committee, zoning_plan)) -> demolishes(contractor, historic_building)) -> preserves(committee, historic_building))
rules.natural: Whenever the negation of the condition that not having mayor approval imply council funding lead to committee delays implying demolition by the contractor is false, the committee preserves the historic building follows.
